definition[0]: a very loud noise made by a large group of people or animals
example[0]: He shouted over the rising clamour of voices.
definition[1]: the expression of feelings of anger and shock by a large number of people – used especially in news reports
example[1]: Trouillot disregarded the growing public clamour for her resignation.
example[2]: The audience cheered, clamoring for more.
example[3]: All his friends were clamouring to know where he’d been.
